page.title: 15BAPCHILD CHURCH
page.content: The church of St Laurence, Bapchild, has a flintstone exterior and is typical of churches in the area. It is a small church capable of holding 150 adults. The stained glass windows have recently been renovated, an event that occurs every hundred years. The screen has been removed from the building which also contains wall paintings that were discovered when decoration was undertaken in recent years. A dinosaur tooth is on display, this being discovered when extensions were made to the sanctuary. The vicar, Rev. Woods, is also responsible for two other churches in the area. The churchyard contains many gravestones which reveal that certain families have resided in the village for centuries.
